title: Flyby vs Cheers: Complete 2025 Comparison [Shark Tank vs Proven Formula]
excerpt: Complete comparison of Flyby Recovery and Cheers Restore. We analyze the Shark Tank brand versus the established formula, breaking down ingredients, pricing, and real effectiveness.

meta.title: Flyby vs Cheers: Complete 2025 Comparison [Shark Tank vs Proven Formula]
meta.description: Flyby vs Cheers Restore comparison. Shark Tank brand vs established formula. Ingredients, pricing, effectiveness analyzed.
meta.keywords: flyby vs cheers, cheers vs flyby, flyby recovery vs cheers restore, shark tank hangover supplement, dhm supplement comparison

author: DHM Guide Team
pros: Both contain DHM as primary ingredient
Available on Amazon with Prime shipping
Established brands with thousands of reviews
cons: Cheers uses proprietary blend (exact DHM amount unclear)
Marketing claims vs actual effectiveness vary

content.text: When it comes to DHM supplements for hangover prevention, Flyby Recovery and Cheers Restore are two of the most searched comparisons. One boasts a Shark Tank appearance, while the other relies on a proven track record. But which one actually delivers better results? Let's dive into a comprehensive, data-driven comparison.
The Shark Tank Factor vs Proven Performance

Cheers Restore proudly displays its "As Seen on Shark Tank" badge, leveraging this appearance for marketing credibility. While Shark Tank exposure can validate a business model, it doesn't necessarily guarantee product effectiveness. Flyby, on the other hand, has built its reputation through consistent customer satisfaction, reflected in its 4.3-star rating from over 7,200 reviews.

content.title: Marketing vs Reality
content.content: Shark Tank appearances are about business viability, not product efficacy. Always look at actual user reviews and ingredient transparency when evaluating supplements.

content.text: DHM Content: Transparency vs Marketing Claims

Here's where things get interesting. Flyby clearly states their DHM content: 300mg per serving. This transparency allows consumers to know exactly what they're getting. Cheers, however, uses the marketing claim of "Most DHM per dose" without specifying the actual amount, hiding behind a proprietary blend label.
Ingredient Profile Comparison
While both supplements center around DHM, their supporting ingredient profiles differ significantly:
Cheers Restore Ingredients:

items: L-Cysteine - amino acid for liver support

content.text: Cheers takes a kitchen-sink approach with multiple ingredients, which can be beneficial but also makes it harder to determine what's actually working. The proprietary blend means we don't know the effective dosages of any ingredient.
Flyby Recovery Ingredients:

Flyby focuses on a more streamlined formula with 300mg of DHM as the star ingredient, supplemented by targeted supporting compounds. This focused approach allows for higher concentrations of key ingredients rather than spreading the formula thin across many components.
Price Analysis: True Cost Per Dose

products.name: Flyby Recovery
products.notes: Higher per-dose cost, but transparent DHM content

products.name: Cheers Restore
products.notes: Lower cost, but unknown DHM concentration

content.text: At first glance, Cheers appears more affordable at $2.92 per serving compared to Flyby's $4.50. However, without knowing the actual DHM content in Cheers, you might be paying less for less active ingredient. Flyby's higher price could reflect a higher concentration of the key ingredient.
Amazon Review Analysis: What Users Really Say
Flyby Recovery (4.3/5 stars from 7,200+ reviews):

negative: Some users need 2 doses for effectiveness

content.text: Cheers Restore (3.9/5 stars from 7,419+ reviews):

negative: Mixed results compared to other brands

content.title: Review Rating Insight
content.content: The 0.4-star difference (4.3 vs 3.9) is significant in the supplement world, especially with such large review volumes. This suggests more consistent satisfaction with Flyby despite the higher price.

content.text: Marketing Claims vs Actual Effectiveness

Cheers leans heavily on their Shark Tank appearance and the claim of having the "most DHM per dose." However, without disclosure of actual amounts, this claim is unverifiable. Marketing prowess doesn't equal product effectiveness.

Flyby takes a more straightforward approach: they tell you exactly what you're getting (300mg DHM) and let the reviews speak for themselves. This transparency builds trust and allows consumers to make informed decisions.
Who Should Choose Which?
Choose Flyby Recovery If:

items: You want a proven DHM dosage (300mg)
Consistent results matter more than price
You prefer focused formulas over kitchen-sink approaches
Higher ratings and review satisfaction are important

content.text: Choose Cheers Restore If:

items: You're impressed by Shark Tank appearances
You want multiple ingredients in one supplement
You're willing to experiment with dosing

content.text: The Verdict: Substance Over Style

While Cheers Restore leverages its Shark Tank appearance and lower price point effectively, Flyby Recovery emerges as the more reliable choice for those serious about hangover prevention. The transparency in DHM content (300mg), higher customer satisfaction (4.3 vs 3.9 stars), and straightforward approach make it worth the extra investment.

The "most DHM per dose" claim from Cheers, without actual numbers to back it up, feels more like marketing spin than consumer transparency. In the supplement world, knowing exactly what you're putting in your body matters.

content.summary: Better transparency, higher customer satisfaction, and proven DHM content make Flyby the superior choice despite the higher price point.

content.text: Frequently Asked Questions

questions.question: Is Cheers really from Shark Tank?
questions.answer: Yes, Cheers did appear on Shark Tank. However, appearing on the show doesn't guarantee product effectiveness - it's a business competition, not a scientific validation.

questions.question: Does Cheers really have the most DHM per dose?
questions.answer: This claim cannot be verified since Cheers uses a proprietary blend and doesn't disclose actual DHM amounts. Flyby's 300mg is a known quantity you can compare.

questions.question: Why is Flyby more expensive than Cheers?
questions.answer: Flyby costs more per dose ($4.50 vs $2.92), possibly due to higher DHM concentration or quality. Without knowing Cheers' actual DHM content, it's hard to determine true value.

questions.question: Which has better reviews?
questions.answer: Flyby has a higher rating (4.3 vs 3.9 stars) despite being more expensive, suggesting better customer satisfaction and effectiveness.

questions.question: Can I take both together?
questions.answer: We don't recommend combining different DHM supplements. Choose one and follow the recommended dosage to avoid potential interactions.

content.text: Final Recommendation

For those seeking the most effective DHM supplement between these two options, Flyby Recovery is the clear winner. Yes, it costs more, but you're paying for transparency, consistency, and proven results backed by superior customer reviews. Cheers Restore might save you money upfront, but without knowing what you're actually getting, it's a gamble on effectiveness.

content.title: Bottom Line
content.content: Choose Flyby for reliability and transparency. Choose Cheers if budget is your main concern and you're swayed by Shark Tank marketing. For best results with either, take before drinking and stay hydrated!

content.title: Ready to Make Your Choice?
content.content: Both supplements are available on Amazon with Prime shipping. Click below to check current pricing and availability:
